title: Why don't we use helium gas to lift our aircraft? - Quora

response.answer_text: We do. But they aren’t all that practical for most things. Take a look at the iconic Goodyear Blimp.  Look at the size of the envelope (the giant part that holds the helium). Next look at the size of the gondola (the little cabin area on the bottom that holds flight crew and passengers - a total of 8 people). If you’re going to carry more passengers, you’re adding more weight. More weight, means bigger envelope. So never mind the speed. Imagine the size of the envelope you’d need to carry one of these:  So to replace jets capable of carrying the same number of people as commercial airliners, you’re looking at massive aircraft that would, additionally, be incredibly slow moving.
We do they are called Airships - Wikipedia The issue is that they can’t move very fast. If you want to travel fast then you need something with low drag you just can’t get low drag with an Airship.
